src:
Tihotapec tudi krivo pričal
Josip Šafranko lagal na sodišču. S pajdašem sta tihotapila 34 ilegalcev.
01 Nov 2019, 09:00 by Nada Černič Cvetanovski



Josip Šafranko naj bi na sojenju pajdašu lagal. FOTO: Nada Černič Cvetanovski



Migrante so vozili v nečloveških razmerah. FOTO: PU Novo mesto


KRŠKO – Zgodba o nečloveškem prevozu 34 ilegalcev, strpanih v kombi, bi počasi že odšla v pozabo, saj sta bila akterja Josip Šafranko in Amir Kulenović že obsojena in že prestajata zaporno kazen, če se ne bi Šafranko ponovno znašel na sodišču. Tokrat 57-letnemu Hrvatu iz Velike Gorice, ki ga na spletnem omrežju označujejo kot »mednarodnega kriminalca, ki je več v zaporu kot doma«, v povezavi s tem primerom očitajo še krivo pričanje.


Migrante so vozili v nečloveških razmerah. FOTO: PU Novo mesto

Potem ko je videl, da se je na sojenju zaradi ilegalnega prevoza tujcev malce preveč zapletel s svojimi izjavami, je dejanje raje priznal in nihče ga ni nič več vprašal. Ker pa njegov pajdaš Kulenović, nekoč je bil Amir Jahić in je že odsedel devetletno zaporno kazen zaradi drog, dejanja ni priznal, so po pravnomočnosti sodbe kot pričo poklicali Šafranka. Ta pa je po prepričanju tožilstva lagal, ko je malo olajšal Kulenovićevo vlogo, malo pa ga je potunkal. Zato mu zdaj grozi novih sedem mesecev zapora. 
Ko je prišla policija, jih je nagnal v gozd
Dogajalo se je 20. julija lani, ko sta se Šafranko in Kulenović s kombijem, v katerem je bilo stlačenih 34 prebežnikov, odpravila na pot. Iz Hrvaške naj bi prek Slovenije tujce prepeljala v Italijo. Do slovenske meje je vozil Šafranko, Kulenović pa je kombi spremljal z osebnim vozilom. Ko sta prispela na območje Gorjancev, sta se zamenjala. Šafranko je z osebnim avtomobilom odpeljal v izvidnico, za njim je v kombiju prebežnike vozil Kulenović. Izvidnik je opazil, da se približuje policijsko vozilo, zato je poklical voznika kombija.Ta je nemudoma zapeljal na gozdno jaso, tujce nagnal v gozd in sam nadaljeval pot. Policisti so ga ustavili, videli prazen kombi, a takoj posumili, za kaj gre. V bližnjem gozdu so odkrili izmučene in izčrpane prebežnike, ki so bili v slabem zdravstvenem stanju in dehidrirani, enega so odpeljali v bolnišnico. Med tujci so bili državljani Pakistana, Iraka, Irana in Somalije, po opravljenih policijskih postopkih in zdravniški oskrbi so jih predali hrvaškim varnostnim organom.Šafranko je krivdo torej priznal, a dejal, da ilegalcev ni prevažal zaradi denarja, temveč zato ker so se mu smilili, še posebno zato, ker je njegova žena muslimanka. Dodal je, da so celo bivali v njegovi hiši, ker jim je v motelu nasproti njegove hiše, kjer so bili nastanjeni prej, zmanjkalo denarja. Zdaj ko se je ponovno znašel na sodišču zaradi krivega pričanja, saj je trdil, da je kombi za prevoz ilegalcev kupil sam, ilegalce pa je vanj stlačil Kulenović, kar menda ne drži, pa pravi, da mu je hiša pogorela, žena pa umrla. Ima le kmetijska zemljišča in očitno precej poln kazenski list. Sicer pravi, da je bil na Hrvaškem obsojen le enkrat in da je ta kazen že izbrisana iz evidenc, a sodišče to še preverja. Kot lahko preberemo na hrvaških spletnih portalih, naj bi imel pred leti skupaj z ženo ilegalno javno hišo.
Obtoženi je dejal, da ilegalcev ni prevažal zaradi denarja, temveč ker so se mu smilili, saj je njegova žena muslimanka.
Šafranko si je zaradi prevoza ilegalcev prislužil leto in osem mesecev zapora, 6000 evrov stranske denarne kazni in štiriletni izgon iz Slovenije, Kulenović pa leto in tri mesece zapora, 1000 evrov denarne kazni, po prestani kazni pa bo štiri leta nezaželen v Sloveniji. Tožilec Bogdan Matjašič se je na sodbo pritožil.
text:
The smuggler also testified incorrectly
Joseph Safranko lied in court. The mate and smugglers smuggled 34 illegals.
01 Nov 2019, 09:00 by Nada Cernic Cvetanovski



Joseph Saffranko allegedly lied at the trial of a mate. PHOTO: Nada Cernic Cvetanovski



The migrants were driven in inhumane conditions. PHOTO: PU Novo mesto


KRŠKO - The story of the inhumane transport of 34 illegals packed into a van would have slowly been forgotten, as the actors Josip Šafranko and Amir Kulenović had already been sentenced and are already serving a prison sentence if Šafranko did not go to court again. This year, a 57-year-old Velika Gorica Croat, who is described on the web as "an international criminal who is more in prison than at home", is accused of perjury in connection with this case.


The migrants were driven in inhumane conditions. PHOTO: PU Novo mesto

After seeing that he was a little overly embarrassed with his statements at the trial for the illegal transportation of foreigners, he preferred to confess the act and no one asked him again. However, because his friend Kulenovic, who used to be Amir Jahic and had already served a nine-year prison sentence for drugs, did not admit the act, they called Šafranko after the verdict. The prosecutor, according to the prosecution, lied after alleviating Kulenovic's role a little and pushing him a little. Therefore, he now faces another seven months in prison.
When police arrived, he chased them into the woods
It happened on July 20 last year, when Šafranko and Kulenović set off on a van with a van that crashed 34 fugitives. Foreigners from Croatia were to be transported via Italy to Italy. Šafranko drove to the Slovenian border, and Kulenović accompanied the van with a personal vehicle. When they arrived in the Gorjanci area, they exchanged. Saffranko drove a reconnaissance car with his car, followed by Kulenovic in the van. The scout noticed that a police vehicle was approaching, so he called the driver of the van. The cops stopped him, saw the empty van, but immediately suspected what it was about. In the nearby forest, exhausted and exhausted refugees were found, who were in poor health and dehydrated, and one was taken to a hospital. The foreigners were nationals of Pakistan, Iraq, Iran and Somalia, after police procedures and medical care were handed over to the Croatian security authorities. Saffranko then pleaded guilty, but said he did not transport the illegals because of money, but because he was pardoned. , especially because his wife is Muslim. He added that they even stayed at his house because they ran out of money at the motel opposite his house where they were previously housed. Now that he is back in court for guilty testimony, claiming that he bought the van to transport the illegals himself, and was illegally charged by Kulenovic, who allegedly does not hold, he says his house was burned and his wife died. It only has agricultural land and apparently a pretty full criminal record. He says he has only been convicted once in Croatia and that the sentence has already been deleted from the records, but the court is still reviewing it. As we can read from Croatian web portals, he and his wife allegedly owned an illegal public house years ago.
The accused said he did not transport the illegals because of money but because they felt sorry for him because his wife was a Muslim.
Saffranko was sentenced to one year and eight months in prison for the transportation of illegals, 6,000 euros in fines and four years' expulsion from Slovenia, and Kulenovic a year and three months in prison, 1,000 euros in fines, and four years in Slovenia, after being sentenced. Prosecutor Bogdan Matjasic appealed the judgment.
